title: Compiler error compiling a yew project (wasm32-unknown-unknown target)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Doesn't seem to be code-related. `rm -rf target` seems to fix it. The issue didn't show up in nightly, but it's possible that's because nightly did a clean rebuild. ### Meta Issue did not present on nightly (1.59.0-nightly (475b00aa4 2021-12-24)), BUT this seems to have been some sort of issue with the target/ directory (see above). Nightly did a clean rebuild, which also seemed to fix stable. I.e. I don't know if this proves that the issue is not present in nightly. Inconclusive at best. `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c commit-date: 2021-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 [omit stack trace] error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
Backtrace
